intro: Brachyglottis bellidioides, commonly known as the silver flax-lily, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its silver-gray leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces small, clustered flowers during the spring and summer months. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
